unparsed_output:
he letter written by William J Darby mentions the Radisson as a preferred choice to stay. This information is clearly stated in the following sentence of the letter:

"I would prefer to be at the Radisson if you would be good enough to make my arrangements there at the appropriate time."

The letter does not mention any other hotel or accommodation. 

Therefore, the preferred place to stay for William J Darby, as stated in the letter, is the Radisson.
